Snikit.About: Some say Snikit went mad after being hit with a stray projectile. Others say he went mad after cracking his skull on a slippery sewer floor. Either way, this crazy Ratling rules the Assassins Guild with an iron claw - at least when he feels like it.
Snikit.Event: Attacks immediately. Disengages at the end of each of his combats. On his turn, 50/50 whether he attacks or wanders randomly.

Krobus.Event:
Demonic portal opens. Will appear in 1-2 turns (enough for player to react for one turn).

Order has a chance to convince the demon to help them. Will turn hostile if fails.

Bounty Hunter.About: The most feared Bounty Hunter in the city. Blah rushes from the shadows and captures her targets before they're aware she's even there.
Bounty Hunter.Event: Appears on nearest board edge and hunts the target.

Thief.About: Frustratingly agile, blah is always one step ahead of everyone else. A thief notorious amongst the nobility, she is the mastermind behind numerous high-profile heists.
Thief.Event: Immediately takes the treasure and tries to move towards the nearest board edge.

Pit Fighter.About: The current champion of the Pits, blah has won the last fifteen matches against largely unwilling opponents. His presence is preceded by the chanting of his adoring fans.
Pit Fighter.Event: Turns into a 1v1 duel. Winner gets two treasures.

Cult Leader.About: This self-proclaimed 'Prophet of the Blight' has supposedly been sent by greater powers to spread the gift of the Blight to all who will listen, and to all who won't. Blah's sermons, and those of his followers, bring a sense of foreboding to all those unlucky enough to hear them.
Cult Leader.Event: Gives the plague. Has cultists nearby that have the plague. Will try to spread it as much as possible.

High Priest.About: As the, now disgraced, head of the church within the city, blah has been heavily criticised for allowing the Blight to spread to all corners of the city. He is commonly seen throughout the city doing his best to heal the diseased and occasionally smite the forces of Chaos.
High Priest.Event: Would try and cure the plague for anyone that comes within 6".

Rebel Leader.Event: Spawn with rabble. Maybe recruits more and attack everyone. Could rout when enough are defeated. May try to steal the treasure.

Black Market Dealer.About: This black market dealer can procure goods for you, for a fee.
Black Market Dealer.Event: Will have the treasure. Will turn hostile if attacked. Will trade another treasure for an automatic roll on the magic table.

Mercenary.About: This mercenary can be convinced to fight for you and just as equally be convinced to fight against you.
Mercenary.Event: Can be bribed when within 6" to join you for the fight (10g?). Opponent can then do the same.

Grand Inquisitor.About: As the head of the inqusition, blah's job is to stamp out the evil, corruption, and rot from the city. He does so through bribery, extortion, and other forms of coercion.

Hero.About: This dwarf is a hero of the people.
Hero.Event: Appears with multiple peasants. Tries to move off the board. If a peasant dies, gain X gold.

Wandering Knight.Event: Starts on board edge. Moves across board. Must make this check if you come within 6". Will turn hostile if you fail. Law has advantage to convince the knight to fight for them. Chaos does not have adv. Make a morale check.

Revenant.Event: Tries to kill your allied faction agent (or leader if you don't have one).

Necromancer.Event: Starts with 2 zombies. Summons one every turn. Attacks everyone.

Berserker.Event: Comes from off the board in random direction. Attacks any in sight.

Gang Member.About: Outcast by society, Ratlings are forced into the edges of the city where they make ends meet by any means necessary. This incentivises them to skirt the law and find creative ways to feed themselves and their families.

Blightchosen.About: A faithful servant of the Blight.
